entry.title: 6 from Minnesota charged with trying to join Islamic State
entry.summary: (AP) - Six Minnesota men have been charged with terrorism in a criminal complaint unsealed Monday, the latest Westerners accused of traveling or attempting to travel to Syria to join the Islamic State group.

entry.title: Six U.S. men charged with conspiring to support Islamic State
entry.summary:
All six men had been conspiring for the past 10 months and were arrested as part of a yearlong FBI investigation into young men from the area trying to travel to Syria to join Islamic State, U.S. prosecutors allege.

In February a Minnesota man stopped in New York last November en route to Syria, was indicted on charges of conspiring to support Islamic State and lying to federal agents investigating recruitment by militant groups.

entry.title: A history of the Islamic State group after Ethiopians killed
entry.summary:
June 29 - The group declares the establishment of an Islamic state, or caliphate, in territories it controls in Iraq and Syria and demands allegiance from Muslims worldwide.

Aug. 19 - The Islamic State group releases a video showing a jihadi behead James Foley, a 40-year-old journalist from Rochester, New Hampshire, in response to the U.S.-led airstrikes.

April 19 - Islamic State affiliates in Libya release a video showing them behead and shoot dead groups of Ethiopian Christians, slayings resembling the February beheadings of the Egyptian Coptic Christians.

entry.title: Islamic State blamed for Afghan suicide bombing killing 35
entry.summary:
Local Afghan media quoted a previously unknown man who identified himself as a spokesman for the Islamic State group's affiliate in the country, claiming responsibility for the attack.

The Islamic State group, currently targeted by a U.S.-led coalition's airstrikes and an Iraqi ground offensive, has seen its public image rise dramatically since it seized much of Iraq last summer.

In recent days, Ismail Khan, long a dominant figure in Afghanistan's western province of Herat, told The Associated Press that the numbers of Islamic State supporters are growing because of divisions in Ghani's government.

entry.title: Afghan blast kills 33; president blames Islamic State
entry.summary: Local media said a former spokesman for the Pakistani Taliban had claimed responsibility on behalf of the Islamic State in both Pakistan and Afghanistan.

entry.title: Islamic State blamed for Afghan suicide bombing killing 35

entry.title: Afghan suicide bombing claimed by the Islamic State group kills at least 33 people
entry.summary: FAIZABAD, Afghanistan - A motorcycle-riding suicide bomber attacked a bank branch Saturday in eastern Afghanistan, killing at least 33 people in a deadly attack the country's president said was claimed by the Islamic State group.

entry.title: Afghan suicide bombing claimed by Islamic State kills 33
entry.summary:
Hours after the attack, President Ashraf Ghani blamed the Islamic State group for the attack.

Ghani warned before that the Islamic State group was starting to establish a presence in Afghanistan.

He called on the Taliban to join with the Kabul government, and said that any Taliban who switched allegiance to Islamic State group would earn the wrath of Afghanistan's religious leaders.

entry.title: Afghan president says Islamic State group has claimed suicide bombing that killed at least 33

Islamic State is on the back foot in the north, where Shi'ite militia and Kurdish forces known as peshmerga went on the offensive around the oil-rich city of Kirkuk on Friday.

The Shi'ite militia are accused of committing abuses against Sunnis in other territory they have retaken from Islamic State - charges they deny.

entry.summary: The Sunni militants' push on Ramadi, launched Wednesday when the Islamic State group captured three villages on the city's eastern outskirts, has become the most significant threat so far to the provincial capital of Anbar.

entry.title: As Islamic State pushes on Iraq's Ramadi, 2000 families flee
entry.summary:
Clashes between Iraqi forces and Islamic State militants pressing their offensive for Ramadi, the capital of western Anbar province, has forced more than 2,000 families to flee from their homes in the area, an Iraqi official said Thursday.

Al-Bayan, the Islamic State group's English-language radio station, claimed IS fighters had seized control of at least six areas and most of a seventh to the east of Ramadi since Wednesday, according to the SITE Intelligence Group, which monitors militant websites.

entry.title: AP Interview: Afghan warlord warns of Islamic State rise

"The differences that exist in the national unity government . are helping to boost the enemies' morale, the morale of Daesh and the Taliban," Khan told the AP, using an acronym for the Islamic State group.

entry.title: Iraqi prime minister making an in-person appeal to Obama for more help fighting Islamic State
entry.summary:
Al-Abadi told reporters Monday that the increase in U.S. airstrikes, weapons deliveries and training has helped roll back Islamic State forces, but he needs greater support from the international coalition to "finish" them.

The U.S. blamed the lack of inclusiveness by al-Abadi's predecessor, Nouri al-Maliki, for giving the Islamic State a recruiting tool and had made the formation of a new government a condition for deeper military action to stop the militant group.

Concern over Iran's role in the fight against Islamic State may also feature in the Obama-Abadi talks.

The Islamic State group "appears to have adopted violent ideas first, then searched books of religious interpretation to find a cover for their actions," said Sheikh Hamadah Nassar, a cleric in the ultraconservative Salafi movement.

entry.title: How strong is the Islamic State in Libya?

The images are clearly aimed as a show of force - an announcement that the Islamic State is now a power in Libya.

Since the beginning of the year, the Islamic State has launched increasingly high-profile attacks, beginning with an assault on Tripoli's Corinthian Hotel that left nine dead, including an American contractor.

entry.title: Islamic State militants claim attacks on embassies in Libya

Kansas man arrested in bomb plot in support of Islamic State
entry.summary:
Booker has been charged with three criminal counts including attempting to use a weapon of mass destruction and attempting to provide material support to Islamic State, a militant group that has captured parts of Iraq and Syria over the past year and has symphathizers in several countries.

Since October, he had unknowingly been in contact with an undercover FBI agent and in March of this year was introduced to another undercover agent who posed as a high-ranking Islamic sheik planning attacks on the United States.

On March 10, Booker, accompanied by the two undercover agents, made an Islamic State propaganda video near Marshall Army Airfield at Fort Riley, prosecutors said.

entry.title: Boko Haram is said to have pledged allegiance to Islamic State
entry.summary:
New York: One of the deadliest terrorist organisations in Africa has pledged allegiance to the Islamic State, according to a message posted online.

If confirmed, the pledge would make the group, Boko Haram, which is believed to have as many as 6,000 fighters, the largest extremist group to date to agree to fight under the Islamic State banner, analysts said.

Terrorism experts say that the pledge, or "bayat", is a spiritually binding oath, and it indicates that Boko Haram's leader agrees to be under the authority of the Islamic State group.

But as with such pledges from other groups elsewhere in the world, including in Libya, it remains unclear how much direct control the Islamic State leaders have over their distant proxies.

If confirmed, the agreement with Boko Haram would mirror the steps taken by Islamic State affiliates in Libya, Algeria, Egypt, Afghanistan and beyond.

"The key question is whether the Islamic State dispatched individuals from Syria or Iraq or else from Libya, down to northern Nigeria to help out with operations on the ground, or else with methodology, or in terms of governance activities."

entry.title: Boko Haram is said to have pledged allegiance to Islamic State
entry.summary:
In the message published on his Twitter account on Saturday, Abubakar Shekau, Boko Haram's leader, announced that he had sworn allegiance to the Islamic State, also known as ISIS.

"It's quite clear that since at least mid-January, the Islamic State has had some level of connection with Boko Haram," said Aaron Zelin, a fellow at the Washington Institute who tracks propaganda by Islamic extremists.

If the Islamic State does embrace Boko Haram, it is uncertain what level of coordination there will be between the terrorist outfits thousands of miles apart.
